Follow us.

Youtube
Instagram

Target Audience.

Posts. Tailored for your audience.

Strike a chord, make a connection and establish trust in consumer.

We recognise our target audience on different platforms and work accordingly in order to provide a seamless experience for our followers. We pay attention to SEO analytics and other ways to measure our reach and modify our content to meet the community guidelines for our followers on various platforms.

We also keep our content short and concise, keeping in mind the 8-second attention span of an average human.

Engineers. Designers.

We engineer. We design. Everything. From scratch.

Our posts are not just based off of our gut feelings and instincts. Each posts is a pre-planned concept, designed on paper, and fabricated on software. 

Special care is given to the colours and font family we use, to create a perfect blend of design elements which is a pleasure to the eyes of the viewer.

 

We also follow the use of Gestalt Design Theory and its workings to create appealing posts which further inspire the user to look further and hence, spread awareness.

Compartmentalisation

We know what, where and when to write.

A general rule of thumb is 3-4 accounts that showcase your brand and highlights your business’ personality. It can be difficult to find the right balance between having enough accounts that will showcase your brand, but not so many that it becomes extremely time-consuming. As a result, we have three social media accounts, across Instagram, Facebook, and Twitter.

Even our sponsors will share our success to inform their audience of us and the competition. This will result in mutual benefits and integrate with other forms of marketing, like website and social media pages.

The voice, tone, moderation and audience of each social media is tweaked to ensure that the communication is highly effective to all of our information. We call this strategy the “compartmentalisation of words through paronomasia.”  

Meet the team

Aditya Pratap Singh

Graphic Designer

Manufacturing Engineer

Our past

In 2019, we participated as Team Savitar, ranking in the Regionals as the Regionals First Runners Up, and winning the Digital Media Award at the Nationals and nominating for the Best Verbal Presentation Award. 

At the World Finals, one of our team members collaborated with Orion Racing, the 2019 National Champions, to represent India at Abu Dhabi. 

With refined focus and a brand new vision, we participated in Season 3, with one aim- to succeed. Pentafluid was built ground up to excel in all aspects of the competition, combining all of our knowledge about everything of relevance.

Pentafluid isn’t just an F1 in Schools team- it’s an experience, an emotion, and our need for success.

Pentafluid

The name Pentafluid is derived from two words- penta, meaning five, standing for the five uniquely talented members of the team who put in maximum effort to ensure victory, and fluid. The word fluid describes the dynamic nature of the team, and how we can adapt to the situation at hand to provide an appropriate response.

Pentafluid was built from scratch as a brand- our design language, termed Fluid Design, aptly mimics fluid behaviour across all elements of UI to provide a sense of brand identity recognisable across all platforms. The logo is a meticulous vector, with an isometric F hiding in the negative space to denote that simplicity is indeed the ultimate sophistication.

 

The F1 IN SCHOOLS Logo, F1, FORMULA 1, FIA FORMULA ONE WORLD CHAMPIONSHIP, GRAND PRIX and related marks are trademarks of Formula One Licensing BV, a Formula One group company. All rights reserved.
